Palm Oil Plantations.Description: Palm oil plantations have a significant impact on the environment, including deforestation, habitat destruction, and greenhouse gas emissions.
Palm oil plantations often interact with local communities, affecting their livelihoods, land rights, and social well-being.
Palm oil plantations pose a major threat to biodiversity, leading to the loss of habitat for many species and contributing to the decline of endangered animals.
The palm oil industry is increasingly pressured to adopt sustainable sourcing practices to minimize negative impacts on the environment, society, and economy.
